mortality.note: Included Halabja chemical attack (5,000 killed in single day). 4,000+ villages destroyed. Up to 182,000 'disappeared' per Kurdish estimates.

rationales.systematic_intensity: Chemical weapons (Halabja), forced relocations, mass executions. Saddam's campaigns.
rationales.profit: Oil-rich Kurdish regions, but primarily political control.
rationales.ideology: Arab nationalism vs Kurdish autonomy. Ethnic targeting explicit.
rationales.complicity: Iraqi military and Ba'ath party. West ignored during Iran-Iraq War. Saddam tried 2006.

analysis.pattern_note: Named after Quranic chapter meaning 'spoils of war'. First use of chemical weapons against civilian population since WWI. Iraqi High Tribunal ruled it genocide in 2006. 'Chemical Ali' (Ali Hassan al-Majid) executed 2010. Western powers largely silent during campaign due to Iran-Iraq War alignment.
analysis.root_causes: Kurdish autonomy threat, Ba'athist Arab nationalism, Iran-Iraq War context
